p: In 1999, the epidemiological pattern of SYF in Brazil has changed, as the majority of human cases have been reported in states from Midwest, Southeast and South region located ( S1B Fig) outside the Amazon Basin ( S1B Fig), mainly during the wet season [ 3]. In 2000–2001, during a YF outbreak in the states of Minas Gerais (MG) and São Paulo (SP), a total of 98 human cases were registered, and epizootics were also reported in the states of Bahia, Paraná and Rio Grande do Sul. Another outbreak outside the Amazon Basin took place in 2008–2009, with 57 human cases reported in Southeast (MG and SP), Northeast (Bahia and Rio Grande do Norte), and South (Rio Grande do Sul) regions. Epizooties were also registered in the states of MG, SP, Rio Grande do Sul and Paraná [ 4, 5].
